programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Connor McDavid and the Oilers try to extend their season as they host the Canucks for Game 6 of their West semifinal. J.T. Miller's last-minute goal in Game 5 pushed Vancouver to a 3-2 win over Edmonton as well as a 3-2 lead in the series.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Emanuel Navarrete takes on Denys Berinchyk for the vacant WBO lightweight belt. Navarrete is attempting to join Mexican-born Erik Morales, Jorge Arce, Juan Manuel Marquez, Leo Santa Cruz, and Canelo Alvarez as a four-weight world champion.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: 2024 PGA Championship
programme.desc: The PGA Championship concludes. With his win at this event in 2023, Brooks Koepka became the 20th golfer with five major championships, and joined Jack Nicklaus and Tiger Woods as the only three-time winners of the PGA during the stroke-play era.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Action from women's college softball.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Action from women's college softball.

programme.title: 7Innings Live
programme.desc: Up-to-date college softball highlights, scores, and analysis live from experts in the studio.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Stingy right-hander Reynaldo López and the Braves continue their four-game series with the Padres. López (2-1, 1.34 ERA) hasn't allowed more than three runs in any of his seven starts. Luis Arráez (SD) is 7-for-20 against the Dominican native.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Knicks host Game 7 of their second-round series against the Pacers. Indiana forced a winner-take-all scenario with a 116-103 verdict in Game 6 on home court. Jalen Brunson (NY) leads all scorers in the NBA postseason with 33.7 points per game.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Sun roll into this road date with the Fever. Connecticut is 2-0, with wins over Washington and a 92-71 verdict over Indiana to begin the season. Fever phenom Caitlin Clark began her WNBA career with 20 points on 5-of-15 shooting in that decision.

programme.desc: Western Conference Second Round, Game 7 (if necessary).

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: The Stallions (7-0) aim to stay perfect when they host the Roughnecks (1-6). Birmingham's 30-26 victory over XFL Conference contender St. Louis in Week 7 kept it unbeaten. Adrian Martinez (BHAM) threw for 230 yards and rushed for 60 more in the win.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Mavericks have the Thunder on the ropes entering Game 6 of their West semifinal. Dallas moved within a game of its second Western Conference final in three years with a 104-92 Game 5 victory over Oklahoma City. Luka Doncic (DAL) triple-doubled.

programme.title: My Name is Dany Garcia
programme.desc: This ESPN documentary examines the life of Dany Garcia, the first female owner of a major sports league, just as spring pro football evolves again with the UFL's debut this weekend.

programme.title: Formula 1: Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Teams make final preparations for the day's race. Plus, interviews, features, and Martin Brundle's popular "grid walk."

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: The Formula One grid touches down in Italy for the Emilia-Romagna Grand Prix. Max Verstappen seeks a third straight win here after last year's edition was canceled due to intense flooding. Lando Norris claimed his first F1 victory in Miami on May 5.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: The 2012 Alabama softball team captures the SEC's first national title in the sport with a talented team powered by friendship, grit, and selflessness.

programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.desc: The Panthers (5-2) prepare for the postseason by taking on the Showboats (1-6) in Week 8. The USFL Conference playoff picture came into focus in Week 7, with Michigan locking in its spot in the title game against Birmingham by beating D.C.

programme.desc: From Truist Park in Atlanta.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Orioles and Mariners resume a three-game set with the middle contest. Seattle starter Luis Castillo won four of his last five turns, and has logged a quality start in six consecutive outings. Anthony Santander (BAL) homered off Castillo in 2023.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Rangers and Angels continue an AL West series. Texas starter José Ureña is 1-1 with a 2.31 ERA in two turns since joining the rotation. Los Angeles lefty Patrick Sandoval looks to bounce back after allowing a career-high 11 hits in a May 12 loss.

programme.title: MLB Postseason Top 10 Moments 2023
programme.desc: We relive the Top 10 most memorable moments from the 2023 MLB postseason.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: North Wilkesboro Speedway hosts the NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series at the Wright Brand 250. Last year, in the first trucks race held at the historic North Carolina track since 1996, 2021 Cup Series champion Kyle Larson got a win for Spire Motorsports.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay
programme.desc: Behind the scenes and up-to-the minute reports from the garage prior to the start of each NASCAR Cup Series race.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Cup Series All-Star weekend continues with the main event. Current points leader Kyle Larson won his third career All-Star race, and second in three years, during North Wilkesboro Speedway's first year hosting the celebrations in 2023.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Wings and Sky meet again. Arike Ogunbowale netted 25 points in the May 15 opener versus Chicago, including 14 in the fourth quarter as Dallas pulled away for an 87-79 victory. Angel Reese (CHI) had 12 points and eight rebounds in her pro debut.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Mercury look to regroup as they play their home opener versus the Dream. Phoenix failed to spoil Las Vegas' banner raising on May 14, falling 89-80 to the Aces. Diana Taurasi, who turns 42 in June, led Phoenix with seven 3-pointers and 23 points.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.

programme.title: Béisbol Esta Noche
programme.desc: Si usted es un fanático del béisbol, entonces no querrá perderse esta noche de recapitulación donde se muestran los momentos más destacados de todos los juegos y actualizaciones de los que siguen en curso. Regularmente presentado por Karl Ravech, quien está acompañado por una combinación de analistas, como los ex jugadores John Kruk y Dave Winfield, el ex manager Terry Francona, y los periodistas Tim Kurkjian y Buster Olney.
